node.title: Google will invest $740 million in Australia, including a research hub.
node.alt: Google said that its plans included working with the Australian authorities to solve problems like protecting the Great Barrier Reef.Â
node.description: After regulatory fights, the search giant pledged to expand its hiring in the country.
node.content: ["Google announced on Tuesday that it would invest $740 million in Australia over the next five years, promising to build a research hub, increase its cloud computing capacity and team up with government scientists to address challenges like expanding the use of green energy.", "The investment \u2014 1 billion Australian dollars \u2014 is the technology giant\u2019s biggest commitment in the country since it opened its Sydney office in 2002, and it follows a bruising battle this year over legislation that eventually required the biggest American technology companies to pay for news appearing on their platforms.", "Australia\u2019s government continues to show interest in additional tech regulation, but on Tuesday, Prime Minister Scott Morrison praised Google for making such a big bet on his country. He said that the company\u2019s new program, the Digital Future Initiative, would create more than 6,000 jobs, triple what Google currently employs in Australia.", "\u201cWe have to embrace and encourage and enable those seeking these new digital opportunities,\u201d Mr. Morrison said.", "Sundar Pichai, Google\u2019s chief executive, said that Australia \u2014 where one of the most successful tech companies is Atlassian, the creators of the business software program Jira \u2014 can help lead the world\u2019s next wave of innovation. Google\u2019s plans include a partnership with the Sydney-based Macquarie University on quantum computing and expanded collaboration with Australia\u2019s main government science agency on everything from natural hazard management to protection for the Great Barrier Reef.", "\u201cWe believe a strong digital future is one where everyone has access to technology and the skills to use it,\u201d Mr. Pichai said. \u201cWhere the internet economy fulfills its immense potential.\u201d"]
